aiMessages.message: What is the compensation cess scrapping impact on my inventory?

The compensation cess has been scrapped with effect from 22.9.2025 for all items except tobacco products. According to CBIC clarification, no refund or adjustment will be provided for cess already paid on inventory held as of that date. The cess credit can only be adjusted against cess liability and cannot be set-off against CGST/SGST/IGST. This impacts the automobile and beverage sectors particularly.
Can I claim ITC on inputs from non-credible suppliers?

No, according to the recent Ambika Traders judgment from Delhi High Court, ITC cannot be claimed on invoices from fake or non-existent suppliers. The Court held that consolidated SCNs covering multiple years are valid in ITC fraud cases. If you claim ITC on fake invoices, penalties equal to the ITC amount plus additional penalty under Section 122 can be imposed.
What are the key changes in GST 2.0?

The 56th GST Council Meeting introduced GST 2.0 with major changes including: (1) Removal of compensation cess for most items, (2) Rationalization of tax rates, (3) Simplified compliance procedures, (4) Enhanced e-commerce provisions. The transition is effective from 22.9.2025. Affected businesses need to revalue inventory and adjust pricing strategies.
